title: Jean-Baptiste Biot
summary: Jean-Baptiste Biot (/ˈbiːoʊ, ˈbjoʊ/;[2] French: [bjo]; 21 April 1774 – 3 February 1862) was a French physicist, astronomer, and mathematician who co-discovered the Biot–Savart law of magnetostatics with Félix Savart, established the reality of meteorites, made an early balloon flight, and studied the polarization of light.
